channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Orban Invites Netanyahu to Hungary, Flouting I.C.C. Arrest Warrant
item.description: Hungary, unlike the United States, is a signatory to the court, which accused the Israeli leader of war crimes in Gaza.

item.title: For Dell, 3 factors explain why transparency is key to its sustainability efforts
item.description: “Our strategy, in a nutshell, is integrate sustainability everywhere,” says chief sustainability officer Cassandra Garber.

item.title: Israel Strikes Across Lebanon After Ordering Evacuations of Southern Towns
item.description: The wide-scale bombardment continued a day after a U.S. envoy held talks with Israeli officials on a possible cease-fire with Hezbollah militants.

item.title: Trump Media explores crypto payment service to go along with Truth Social, filings show
item.description: Trump Media filed a trademark application for a cryptocurrency wallet called TruthFi.

item.title: Here’s the formula companies like Netflix, Uber, and Spotify will use to capture $2T in growth over the next decade
item.description: In the age of AI, competitive advantage is increasingly determined by a company's ability to deliver personalized experiences at scale.

item.title: Russia Supplies Antiaircraft Missiles to North Korea, the South Says
item.description: Pyongyang has long coveted an advanced air-defense system to guard against missiles and war planes from the United States and South Korea.

item.title: CFOs have an essential role in keeping companies innovative
item.description: Innovation requires resources. Chief financial officers have a large say in how the money is spent.

item.title: Covid Can Raise the Risk of Heart Problems for Years
item.description: People who had severe infections are especially vulnerable.

item.title: Guard at U.S. Embassy in Norway Accused of Spying for Russia and Iran
item.description: The Norwegian man was arrested this week in Oslo and ordered jailed pending further investigation in what the authorities called a ‘very serious case....

item.title: At COP29 Politicians Are Talking About Climate Change. Here’s What’s Happening.
item.description: Every month so far has seen floods, fires, smashed heat records or some combination of extreme weather. Little time remains for leaders to agree on wh...
